channel.title: File sharing is not piracy
channel.description:
[img]http://markshroyer.com/files/piracy.png[/img]
i did not make this, just found it funny and decided to share it whit you guys
EDIT: One little thing, if Niall or Algas read this, I sent you guys a pm a few days ago, would be very nice if one of you could send me a answer.

item.title: File sharing is not piracy
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:4, topic:228655”][quote author=Niall link=topic=300672.msg2413531#msg2413531 date=1220044346]

Since it copies the original and gives it for free, it’s illegal anyway, what if it were something like an OS?

So, if I was to leand a DVD out to a friend, that would be illegal?

[/quote]
Yes techinically it is[/quote]
In Norway and maybe other places that is legal.
You can copy it and give the copy away to friend and near family.
And of course lend the orginale to people so long you don’t earn on it.

But Tritrans is not agree with you Lordbost.

English: piracy Spanish: piratería Norwegian: krenkelse av copyright, piratkopiering, piratutgivelse, piratvirksomhet, sjørøveri, ulovlig ettertrykk.

Only one translation is that you mean, steal things on the sea.
So GCCI and Filesharing is PIRACY.

Read full topic

item.title: File sharing is not piracy

item.description:
@skiller_noob1 wrote:

Then move the a small deserted island, and stay there with a laptop that is powered by coconut juice. Then you don’t have to worry about Copy Right problems.

item.title: File sharing is not piracy
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:4, topic:228655”][quote author=Niall link=topic=300672.msg2413531#msg2413531 date=1220044346]

Since it copies the original and gives it for free, it’s illegal anyway, what if it were something like an OS?

So, if I was to leand a DVD out to a friend, that would be illegal?

[/quote]
Yes techinically it is[/quote]

No its not, you can transfer copyright use rights*, the point is that when you lend someone a book or DVD you cant keep using it while they have it, whereas if you copy it you can both use it.

*at least in the UK and USA

Read full topic

item.title: File sharing is not piracy
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Niall:

[quote author=lordbost link=topic=300672.msg2413265#msg2413265 date=1220033927]EDIT: One little thing, if Niall or Algas read this, I sent you guys a pm a few days ago, would be very nice if one of you could send me a answer.

My answer is no, I gave custom titles out to a few people not long back, and the whole week after I was badgered for custom titles.[/quote]

So can I get a custom title?

But I like the little chart you have there lordbost, I’m sure that will help some people understand File Sharing, and the many misconceptions about it.

Read full topic

item.title: File sharing is not piracy
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Unid H4x0r:

Since it copies the original and gives it for free, it’s illegal anyway, what if it were something like an OS?

So, if I was to leand a DVD out to a friend, that would be illegal? (Giving something out for free, not copying something obviously).

[hr]

lordbost:

EDIT: One little thing, if Niall or Algas read this, I sent you guys a pm a few days ago, would be very nice if one of you could send me a answer.

My answer is no, I gave custom titles out to a few people not long back, and the whole week after I was badgered for custom titles.
